channel.title: Best Programming Language For You?
channel.description:
Pick [b]five[/b] programming languages that you think are the best to learn. I will use this to decide which programming languages I will have on the programming section of my upcoming website.
Statistics on this [url=http://www.tiobe.com/index.htm?tiobe_index]website[/url].
Also what are the best tutorial websites for learning programming?
Thanks, Leader

item.title: Best Programming Language For You?
item.dc:creator: @ags1 ags1
item.description:
@ags1 wrote:

You forgot FreeBasic.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Programming Language For You?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:34, topic:33432”]But you can’t make any programs with HTML?

Wikipedia:

Non-computational languages, such as markup languages like HTML or formal grammars like BNF, are usually not considered programming languages.

If you are going to consider HTML a programming language, then the BBcode used on this forum is also a programming language. :)[/quote]For the record, Backus Naur(sp?) Form sucks

Read full topic

item.title: Best Programming Language For You?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:8, topic:33432”]Im undecided on that opinion, mopman.

Html is a language deciphered by the browser, so theoretically, its a programming language, just like java that is deciphered by the jvm.[/quote]

But you can’t program anything with it, just define the formatting and layout of documents, so it’s a markup language like RTF rather than a programming language like Java. (imo)

Read full topic

FUCK BILL </3[/quote]

item.title: Best Programming Language For You?
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

FYI, all of sean's vids are here: http://sean.cruels.net/ Otherwise you have to pay for most of 'em.
Just a comment about tutorial video sites.

I suppose they’re good, (I watched a few and he was explaining concepts, assuming you watch them in order carefully), but if possible, if you know anyone in real life who can help you, who is an expert, ask them for help. It’s an excellent way of learning, because you’re guaranteed to understand properly, rather than just taking concepts for granted.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Programming Language For You?

item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Delphi FTW! w00t! lol

Read full topic

item.title: Best Programming Language For You?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

FYI, all of sean’s vids are here: http://sean.cruels.net/
Otherwise you have to pay for most of 'em.

I’d also say to learn ASM… at least to an extent.
C++ is optimized fairly well, but there may be several occasions when you need a simple routine to go faster or execute differently. Not to mention is essential for debugging.
A good practice is to use something like GCC to view intermediate C compilation files so that you can see how C actually translates into ASM. It doesn’t have to be GCC, but I think it’s better to stick with the simple… else you’ll get a hundred of lines of ASM code for only a few lines, or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Programming Language For You?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“Zeh Progage, post:22, topic:33432”]PHP, Java, C++, and Visual Basic, haven’t learned the others and HTML isn’t a programming language, it’s just a markup language, which is VERY simple. And Javascript is just a client side, web based “programming” language, its basically a lower-level programming language lol.
http://www.seangreasley.com/ is where I learned my C++, Java, and Visual Basic.
I learned PHP at this WONDERFUL site http://www.phpvideotutorials.com/ I also learn other PHP stuff at http://www.gotoAndLearn.com/ but it’s mainly a Flash 8 (Action Script 2.0) tutorial website.[/quote]

Thanks for giving us some programming tutorial sites.

Read full topic

http://www.seangreasley.com/ is where I learned my C++, Java, and Visual Basic.
I learned PHP at this WONDERFUL site http://www.phpvideotutorials.com/ I also learn other PHP stuff at http://www.gotoAndLearn.com/ but it’s mainly a Flash 8 (Action Script 2.0) tutorial website.
